title: Ethiopia: Fitch Affirms Ethiopia At 'B' With Outlook Stable
text:
Africa: STC Conference Concludes With Key Exchanges On Malabo Declaration Fitch Ratings has affirmed Ethiopia's long term foreign and local issuer default ratings (IDR) at "B", with a stable outlook. The ratings on unsecured foreign currency bonds and country ceiling and short term foreign currency IDR were also put at "B". Weak development and governance indicators keep the country at a "B" rating, while a low income per head and human development indicator, even among B rated peers, show weak debt tolerance. While massive public investments by government and state-owned enterprises have led to 10% growth, there is also a rise in indebtedness. Other rating drivers include high and volatile inflation, rapid rise in credit and weak export performance. A positive rating action could come about through stronger external indicators such as higher exports, FDI and international reserves, as well as structural improvements and better macro-policy such as supporting moderate inflation.
